recipes.title: Peanut Butter Cookie Tart

winePairing.pairingText: Tart works really well with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 19 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: In a food processor blend the oats and the salt together until mixture looks like flour. Add in the dates and the peanut butter and blend for 30-45 seconds. Add in the almond ilk and pulse until everything is combined. Divide dough between 6 mini tart pans, pressing dough in to each pan.In a microwave safe bowl, microwave the chocolate chips and coconut oil for about 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until chips are melted. Pour the melted chocolate over the tops of each tart.Refrigerate tarts for at least an hour. Remove from tart pan and get out your fork {I ate mine with ice cream!]

steps.step: In a food processor blend the oats and the salt together until mixture looks like flour.
Add in the dates and the peanut butter and blend for 30-45 seconds.

Add in the almond ilk and pulse until everything is combined. Divide dough between 6 mini tart pans, pressing dough in to each pan.In a microwave safe bowl, microwave the chocolate chips and coconut oil for about 2 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until chips are melted.
Pour the melted chocolate over the tops of each tart.Refrigerate tarts for at least an hour.
Remove from tart pan and get out your fork {I ate mine with ice cream!]
